oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Grand Army of the Republic (GAR) certificate of Joseph I. Mahar
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Commissioned Joseph I. Mahar as an assistant inspector in the GAR. Mahar was a farmer from Coffee Landing, near Shiloh in Hardin County, Tennessee, and returned there after the war. Mahar served in the U. S. Navy aboard the U.S.S. Tyler, and took part in the battles of Ft. Henry and Ft. Donelson. Discharged from the Navy in March 1862 after contracting measles, Mahar enlisted as a private in Co. F, 13th Ill. Cav., USA, in Dec. 1863 and served in Arkansas until the outfit was disbanded on August 31, 1865.
